11-20.title: "THY WILL, NOT MINE"
11-20.quote: . . . when making specific requests, it will be well to add to each one of them this qualification. ". . . if it be Thy will."
11-20.source: TWELVE STEPS AND TWELVE TRADITIONS, p. 102
content: I ask simply that throughout the day God place in me the best understanding of His will that I can have for that day, and that I be given the grace by which I may carry it out. As the day goes on, I can pause when facing situations that must be met and decisions that must be made, and renew the simple request: "Thy will, not mine, be done."

I must always keep in mind that in every situation I am responsible for the effort and God is responsible for the outcome. I can "Let Go and Let God" by humbly repeating: "Thy will, not mine, be done." Patience and persistence in seeking His will for me will free me from the pain of selfish expectations.
